oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lithograph roster of Co. L, 117th Infantry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This lithograph roster of Co. L, 117th Inf. Regt., 30th Div., includes the names and ranks of soldiers, locations of training and deployment, battles fought, and brief history of the company. Mobilized at Camp Sevier, SC on Sept. 8, 1917, the company went to New Jersey, sailed to England, then to France. They spent three weeks at the Tunneling Camp in Belgium, then went to support efforts in France until the Hindenburg Line was broken. The company mustered out at Chickamauga Park in April 1919.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
